abstract: In a speech Monday night, the Federal Reserve chairman highlighted the lack of progress in overhauling something called the tri-party repo market, through which banks and other financial firms borrow and lend money.
snippet: In a speech Monday night, the Federal Reserve chairman highlighted the lack of progress in overhauling something called the tri-party repo market, through which banks and other financial firms borrow and lend money.
lead_paragraph: Ben S. Bernanke, the chairman of the Federal Reserve, doesn’t sound very happy with the state of affairs in a crucial part of the financial system.

headline.main: Bernanke Quietly Criticizes Lack of Repo Reforms
